messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name: I will derive this data from the following paragraph: CASE NAME: The Cryptic Cinema Conundrum DATE: 01/01/72 The courtroom resonated with relentless questioning as the trial proceeded. The prosecution called the officers pivotal to the investigation to unveil their findings. LAW ENFORCEMENT TESTIMONY: PROSECUTOR: Please state your name and role in the investigation. WITNESS: I am Captain A. B. Adams, the main investigator of this case. PROSECUTOR: Thank you, Captain Adams. Can you narrate the events on the night the conundrum was noticed? WITNESS: Absolutely. On the night of May 5th, Officer C. D. Davis encountered unusual activity at the cinema and reported it. The investigation commenced at once. PROSECUTOR: Who oversaw the forensic examination? WITNESS: Sergeant E. F. Evans and Technician G. H. Harris were tasked with the forensic analysis. PROSECUTOR: Who took charge of the interrogations? WITNESS: Detectives I. J. Johnson and K. L. King undertook the interrogations of suspects and potential witnesses. PROSECUTOR: Thank you. No further questions. The Defense delved into a meticulous cross-examination of Captain Adams regarding the investigative techniques. Throughout the trial, Patrol Officer M. N. Nelson, Patrol Officer O. P. Owens, and Patrol Officer Q. R. Rogers were also brought to testify.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: Captain A. B. Adams 
Officer Context: Captain Adams is the main investigator in the Cryptic Cinema Conundrum case, narrating the events on the night the conundrum was noticed during the trial. 
Officer Role: Captain 

Officer Name: Officer C. D. Davis 
Officer Context: Officer Davis noticed unusual activity at the cinema on the night of May 5th, which initiated the investigation. 
Officer Role: Officer 

Officer Name: Sergeant E. F. Evans 
Officer Context: Sergeant Evans, alongside Technician G. H. Harris, oversaw the forensic examination related to the case. 
Officer Role: Sergeant 

Officer Name: Technician G. H. Harris 
Officer Context: Technician Harris worked with Sergeant E. F. Evans on the forensic analysis concerning the unusual activity at the cinema. 
Officer Role: Technician 

Officer Name: Detective I. J. Johnson 
Officer Context: Detective Johnson, alongside Detective K. L. King, took charge of interrogations of suspects and potential witnesses to gather more information regarding the conundrum. 
Officer Role: Detective 

Officer Name: Detective K. L. King 
Officer Context: Detective King, along with Detective I. J. Johnson, was tasked with interrogating individuals to collect additional information about the incident. 
Officer Role: Detective 

Officer Name: Patrol Officer M. N. Nelson 
Officer Context: Patrol Officer Nelson was brought to testify during the trial, although their specific role in the investigation was not detailed in the transcript. 
Officer Role: Patrol Officer 

Officer Name: Patrol Officer O. P. Owens 
Officer Context: Patrol Officer Owens was also called to testify during the trial, although their specific role in the investigation was not detailed in the transcript. 
Officer Role: Patrol Officer 

Officer Name: Patrol Officer Q. R. Rogers 
Officer Context: Patrol Officer Rogers was summoned to testify during the trial, although their specific role in the investigation was not detailed in the transcript. 
Officer Role: Patrol Officer
